title: Introduction To African American Studies
description: Introduction to the philosophical and methodological principles underlying Afro-American studies. Dimensions of the black experience, including history, education, politics, psychology, economics, religion, social organization, and art, will be covered, and the requisite academic tools and sources will be examined.

title: Black Women Rising
description: This course examines the rise of black women and their impact on economic, social, and cultural issues.

title: Black Politics
description: Focus on specific topics of the personal experiences of blacks, in Africa and the diaspora, including black identity, black culture, and the relationships between blacks and society.

title: History Of Injustice In The US
description: Focuses on a specific topic that relates to selected issues in the life, history, and culture of peoples of African ancestry.

title: Blacks In Hollywood Film
description: A history of the representation of blacks in mainstream film throughout the twentieth century.
